Question: It was prefaced with a poem by Ben Jonson, in which this person is hailed, presciently, as "not of an age, but for all time.".
Hints: This person was not revered in his lifetime, but he received a large amount of praise.
Another 18th-century story has this person starting his theatrical career minding the horses of theatre patrons in London.
Most of this person's greatest post-1599 plays were written for the Globe, including Hamlet, Othello and King Lear.
